article:
When spring comes, flowers are beginning to come out. For teenagers in the US that means a vacation is on _  way.
In the US, students may begin their spring vacation at different times, depending on  _  they live. So while students from one town are on vacation, their neighbors in the next town might  have classes as usual. Spring vacation is also known _  "spring break". During this time, students have one or two weeks off from school. The break usually happens in late March or _ .
Spring break is a _  time. Teachers usually don't give homework over the break, so students can spend their days and nights free from school-time stress. There are lots of ways to spend the time. Some families go on vacation, visit a new state or even a new _ . Others may ravel to visit family members who live far away. Some students _ relax at home or visit friends' houses. Sometimes teachers lead overseas trips for groups of students. On a ten-day trip, for example, students might have a  _  through Spain, France, and Italy. These trips are often expensive,  _  they give students an unusual chance to see other parts of the world.
